description: Dome On/Off zwave wall plug for controlling small appliances and lights.
exclusion: Press the BUTTON quickly 3 times in a row. A yellow LED will flash five times indicating exclusion/disconnection.
inclusion: Quickly press the BUTTON 3 times. A yellow LED will flash five times indicating inclusion.
label: DMOF1
overview: The Dome On/Off Plug-In Switch is a Z-Wave Plus device that plugs into a standard 3-prong power outlet and lets you turn on or off any connected electronic device. The On/Off Plug-In Switch also monitors how much energy the attached device uses, and reports the data to your Z-Wave Hub.

category.label: Power Outlet
category.description: Small devices to be plugged into a power socket in a wall which stick there

parameters.label: Disable Meter Functionality
parameters.overview: This parameter enables/disables the METER_REPORT function, which sends periodic reports to Group1 members with information on line voltage, current load, and power & energy consumption. Also see Param 2 & 6.

parameters.label: METER_REPORT
parameters.overview: This parameter sets the amount of time between each successive METER_REPORT signal sent to Group 1 (also see Param 1 & 6.)

parameters.label: Set "Overload" Current level
parameters.description: Maximum current the plug will pass
parameters.overview: Sets the maximum current the plug will pass before it cuts off power and sends a NOTIFICATION_EVENT_POWER_ MANAGEMENT_OVER_LOAD_DETECTED signal to Group 1 and a BASIC_SET(FF) to Group 2. The LED will then blink red once per second until the current returns to normal. To clear the NOTIFICATION and start monitoring again, the BUTTON must be pushed once (only after the current is back to normal.) NOTE: this value must be higher than Param 4

parameters.label: Set "Alert" Current Level
parameters.overview: Sets the current level at which the On/Off Plug-In Switch will flash its LED yellow, until the current returns to below this level. It will NOT cut off current to the device; this functions as a visible warning to the user. NOTE: this value must be lower than Param 3

parameters.label: Enable/Disable Indicator LED
parameters.description: This parameter enables or disables the indicator LED.

parameters.label: Current change METER_REPORT level
parameters.description: Report of relative change in current flow
parameters.overview: In addition to sending a METER_REPORT to Group 1 in the time interval set by Param 2, the On/Off Plug-In Switch also sends a METER_REPORT when it detects a relative change in current flow. This parameter sets this minimum current change amount, in percent, at which point the On/Off Plug-In Switch will send a METER_REPORT to Group 1. Also see Param 1 & 2.

parameters.label: Remember On/Off status
parameters.description: Remember status from last plug in.

parameters.label: Enable/Disable Timer Function
parameters.description: Timer once plugged in before it turn off the device.
parameters.overview: If this parameter is enabled, whenever the On/Off Plug-In Switch is turned on, it will automatically turn off after a set amount of time (set in Param 9.)

parameters.label: Set Timer Time Interval
parameters.description: Time before auto shut off if on.
parameters.overview: Sets the time interval before the On/Off Plug-In Switch automatically shuts off. See Param 8.

parameters.label: Enable/Disable BUTTON
parameters.overview: If this parameter is enabled, the user can turn the device on or off using the BUTTON.

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview: Group 1 is the “Lifeline” group, which can hold five devices. The On/Off Plug-In Switch sends this group a Notification Report and Binary Switch Report whenever it is turned on or off. It also sends a Meter Report incrementally based on time (see Param 2,) or when a relative change in power usage is detected (see Param 6.) Finally, the On/Off Plug-In Switch sends this group a Device Reset Locally notification to remove itself from the Z-Wave network.

associations.label: Group 2
associations.overview: The On/Off Plug-In Switch sends a BASIC_SET(FF) command to Association Group 2 to directly trigger devices (like a siren, chime, etc.) when the current passes above the level set in Parameter 3. When the current drops below the level again, a BASIC_SET(00) command is sent to reset the device (e.g. turn off the siren.) This Group can hold five devices.

associations.label: Group 3
associations.overview: The On/Off Plug-In Switch sends Notification Reports to Group 3, and it can hold five devices.
